clinical_study.brief_title: Myofascial Release in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Myofascial Release in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to assess the effects of a myofascial release protocol in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

detailed_description.textblock:
So far, there are no previous studies that analyze the effects of a myofascial relaxation protocol applied to the diaphragm within the respiratory rehabilitation treatment in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Aim: The main objective of this study is to assess the effects of a 3 weeks myofascial release protocol applied to the diaphragm on respiratory parameters in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
Design: Randomized clinical trial

primary_outcome.measure: Quality of life measured with the Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test: Score
primary_outcome.description: Score (0-40) higher scores mean a worse outcome.

arm_group.description: Respiratory rehabilitation programme + sham Myofascial Release

intervention.description: 6 sessions of: Myofascial Release (20 minutes each) + Respiratory rehabilitation (60 minutes each)
6 sessions of: Sham Myofascial Release (20 minutes each) + Respiratory rehabilitation (60 minutes each)
